```{r setup, include=FALSE}
library(tidyverse)
library(here)
library(sf)
library(tmap)
```

### Read in SF trees data

```{r}

sf_trees <- read_csv(here("data", "sf_trees", "sf_trees.csv"))

```

### Basic Wrangling reminders

Refresh some skills for data wrangling and summary stats using functions in the `dplyr` package. 

Find top 5 highest observations of trees by legal status, do some wrangling, make a graph.

```{r}

top_5_status <- sf_trees %>% 
  count(legal_status) %>%  # group_by then summarise_n
  drop_na(legal_status) %>% # removes missing values from a certain variable
  rename(tree_count = n) %>% # new name on left
  relocate(tree_count) %>% 
  slice_max(tree_count, n = 5) # identify rows with highest values then keeps those rows



```
